body.p: The probability is 0.015 that a standardized normal variable takes a value above what particular value of z? In other words, what is the value of z that satisfies P(Z > z) = 0.015?

response.feedback: Incorrect. It seems you were working with 0.15 instead of 0.015.
Incorrect. −2.17 satisfies P(Z < −2.17) = 0.015, and we are looking for the value of z that satisfies P(Z > z) = 0.015. Review part (b) of the last example, and try again.
